result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigial Kincheloe.  Defendant David C Juarez not in court.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for David C Juarez. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Matter called early, if any victims appear at 10:00 when it was set court will recall matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
dated 10-27-2022, filed by Atty. Anna Kees requesting to adjourn the hearing on 10-31-2022
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty. Anna Kees
Def signed Cash Bond.  Warrant canceled
Defendant failed to sign cash bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing  the $750 cash bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released.

Motion requesting extension filed by the Defendant**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 10/6 "Denied. Mount Pleasant is not hours away, and it is reasonable that Mr. Juarez find a way to have his bond signed within 5 business days. The warrant that will issue may be quashed by the signing of the Bond conditions."
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Fax confirmation of Cash Bond sent

addressed to: David C Juarez for hearing on September 30, 2022
Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward.

CASH BOND previously posted on 9/29/2022.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witnesses/Kay's Jewelers listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to sign bond within the next 5 business days, if it is not sign a warrant

1:02 PM Defendant David C Juarez appeared by zoom video. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  
Defendant has not received of copy complaint and waives reading of complaint. Clerk's office to send a copy of the complaint to the defendant.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court Record Text sealed by Jennifer R Dorow, Judge on Other papers event, dated 2022-09-21
